description:
go.crypto/salsa20: add package.

Package salsa20 implements the Salsa20 stream cipher as specified in
http://cr.yp.to/snuffle/spec.pdf.

(Reference implementation by dchest.)

https://codereview.appspot.com/6496083/diff/1002/salsa20/salsa/salsa20_ref.go#newcode206
salsa20/salsa/salsa20_ref.go:206: // In and out may be the same slice but otherwise should not overlap. Counter
The argument is called "nonce", however you're referring to it here as "counter". (In amd64 version the argument is called "counter").

https://codereview.appspot.com/6496083/diff/1002/salsa20/salsa20.go
File salsa20/salsa20.go (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/6496083/diff/1002/salsa20/salsa20.go#newcode14
salsa20/salsa20.go:14: nonce) pair is a error that leads to trivial plaintext recovery. This is
an error.

But I'd remove "an error", because users could think it's an actual error generated by code instead of their mistake.

Encrypting two different messages with the same (key, nonce) pair leads to trivial plaintext recovery.

https://codereview.appspot.com/6496083/diff/1002/salsa20/salsa20.go#newcode23
